techmeme.title: Meta rolls out an update to "significantly" reduce the Quest 3's passthrough distortion and warping, an experimental wrist-mounted menu button option, and more (David Heaney/UploadVR)
Google's chief privacy officer, Keith Enright, plans to depart the tech giant after 13 years; Matthew Bye, director of competition law, also plans to leave (Forbes)
BrightEdge: Google's AI Overviews now shows in less than 15% of search queries but on 63% of health care-related queries, more than any other industry category (Danny Goodwin/Search Engine Land)
Databricks says it will acquire Tabular, a data management startup that helps companies optimize data stored in the Apache Iceberg format and more, for over $1B (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Sources: TikTok accounts, including brands and celebrities like CNN and Paris Hilton, are getting hacked via a zero-day exploit that only requires opening a DM (Emily Baker-White/Forbes)
